definition: lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
egg/ovum/spawn/(coll.) testicles/(old) penis/(expletive) fucking

sentences.english: Any company that cuts back on research and development is killing the goose that lays the golden egg.
sentences.chinese: 那些削减科研费用的公司，等于是在杀鸡取卵。

sentences.english: If had the day I to walk, you left no ground forgot me.
sentences.chinese: 假若有天我走了，你就杀鸡取卵的把我忘掉。

sentences.english: Emmy, you don't want to take the eggs out of that nest.
sentences.chinese: 艾美，你不想做杀鸡取卵的事吧。

sentences.english: That will be killing the goose that lays the golden egg.
sentences.chinese: 那就成了杀鸡取卵，只顾眼前。

definition: lit. to drain the pond to get at the fish (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
see 竭澤而漁|竭泽而渔[jie2 ze2 er2 yu2]
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
to lack foresight
to dig one's own grave
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
loss/to sustain losses
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
to make a loss
